meanings.definition: To inhale suddenly with the mouth open, out of pain or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: She gasped when she touched the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The child gasped in fear when the thunder roared.
meanings.sent3: The puppy gasped in mock horror at the sight of a toy spider.
meanings.sent4: The news of her promotion made her gasp with joy.
meanings.sent5: He gasped in disbelief as the magician made the coin disappear.

meanings.definition: To breathe in suddenly and loudly with the mouth open, out of surprise or shock.
meanings.sent1: The hiker gasped as he reached the mountain peak.
meanings.sent2: She gasped when she saw the price of the designer bag.
meanings.sent3: The cat gasped in pretend shock at the sight of a cucumber.
meanings.sent4: The audience gasped at the unexpected plot twist in the play.
meanings.sent5: He gasped with excitement as he opened the gift box.
